examples: the essential goodness of human nature
evidence of God’s goodness
(formal) At least have the goodness (= good manners) to look at me when I'm talking to you.

the difference between good and evil.

meanings.def: the part of something that has a useful effect on somebody/something, especially somebody’s health
examples: These vegetables have had all the goodness boiled out of them.
Branches pruned from the trees are shredded so the goodness goes back into the soil.

meanings.def: used to emphasize that you do not know something
examples: God knows what else they might find.
‘Where are they?’ ‘Goodness knows.’

meanings.def: used to emphasize the truth of what you are saying
examples: She ought to pass the exam—goodness knows she's been working hard enough.
Goodness, what a big balloon!
My goodness, you have been busy!
Goodness me, no!

meanings.def: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true
examples: Honest to God, Mary, I'm not joking.

meanings.def: because of kind feelings, without thinking about what advantage there will be for you
examples: You're not telling me he offered to lend you the money out of the goodness of his heart?

meanings.def: used to say that you are pleased about something
examples: Thank God you're safe!
‘Thank goodness for that!’ she said with a sigh of relief.
Thank heavens I've found my keys.

meanings.def: used after a verb to emphasize a particular hope, wish, etc.
examples: I wish to God you'd learn to pay attention!
